website_summaries.verdict: Reasonable price point for a dog wheelchair to support rear legs for larger animals.
pros: Adjustable size so you can create a precise fit
Large wheelchair fits animals with hind leg heights between 20 and 26 inches
Lightweight aluminum frame is also tough
Dogs have plenty of support in the hips and back with the comfortable harness
cons: Can be tricky to dial in just the right fit
Screws on frame must be checked regularly as they may loosen

customer_reviews.title: Great product for its price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. It has helped my dog gain his freedom again, he gets sick excited every time he sees me grab the harness. I found the instruction manual to be confusing as there are two supports that can be used, and the one shown is the one they suggest not to use first. However a YouTube search helped me find a video on the other version. Also: I had to buy a very small tire pump as my regulars didn’t fit in the narrow space allowed to reach the inner tube.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Terry

customer_reviews.title: Old dog, new tricks......
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t receive instructions with it but it was easy enough to find on the internet. We have an older dog who’s losing the mobility in her back legs and thought this would assist but she wants nothing to do with it lol. For the times I’ve been able to convince her it’s been good for her.
customer_reviews.author: IslandLady_04

customer_reviews.title: awsome product
customer_reviews.text: works awesome! could be a little more sturdy, but my akita is 110lbs and she gets a little excited at times and rolls her cart over. I would suggest once you figure out adjustment to use lock-tight in fasteners. I constantly re-tighten wheel bolts hand tight every use. would highly recommend this item! my dog has spinal myopathy and can no longer use her back legs. she loves her "chariot". she is all smiles when I get her harness out and loves to go on her daily walks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to put together and actually hurt my dog
customer_reviews.text: Guys, my dog tore both her back ACLs this week; I was relieved to get this in the mail because she's in misery. Then I tried to put it together, and it took four hours. The instructions and pictures differed entirely and were next to impossible to piece together. When I finally did and tried it out, my dog's leg got stuck in the harness. Then she peed all over it because of the placement of the harness. So now I'm stuck with this incredibly expensive, torn, urine soaked, unusable wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: We are very happy with this product and so is our dog
customer_reviews.text: Our dog picked up on it right away. We are very happy with this product and so is our dog :)
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great wheels !
customer_reviews.text: Well made quality parts. It was easy to assemble, it's sturdy and adjustable for perfect fit. It comes with both the sport harness and comfort harness for rear support and the front harness is a comfortable attachment to the frame. Winnie is mobile again! There are excellent helpful videos available at the company's website and on their YouTube channel. The price is outstanding for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dogmom54

customer_reviews.title: Watch YouTube videos to use this cart correctly
customer_reviews.text: This took A LOT of trial and error. The directions that come with the cart are awful. I ended up watching multiple YouTube videos to figure out the best way to get my dog attached. Ended up just using the “sports harness” and ignored the other large pad one.
customer_reviews.author: packtwin

customer_reviews.title: Flat Tires and Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! Neither wheel will hold air, drinking it USELESS. Fluids leak from the tires. The manufacturer said call Amazon. Amazon refunded 25% of the cost but now I have to go find my own wheels, create a "rig" fit it and my dog is still paralyzed. Time is of the essence. I could have disassembled, repackaged, taken to UPS for a full refund but I kinda need my dog to be mobile NOW, not in another 7-10 days, at already waiting 5 days for it. Bad product, poor service. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: My pup didn’t get to use this but once, he passed before he could use it longer, but it was a lifesaver for him to use and not have to hold himself up to pee highly recommended

customer_reviews.title: This chair works, Know what you are ordering, Though dont expect it to be the answer for everything.

The assembly is easy, The Book is pretty useless but with common sense it isn't a problem.

customer_reviews.title: Able to Walk Again without falling
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to figure out how to rig the straps to help support my dogs hind legs. Overall the chair helps him to go on walks and for longer distances.

product_meta.title: Best Friend Mobility BFML-S&J Elite Dog Wheelchair, Large,Aluminum
product_meta.description: Universal yet customizable dog wheelchair design. Here at Best Friend Mobility, we believe that each dog is an individual, and that as such, will have individual needs, habits, mannerisms, and a stance that’s all its own. Our patented, orthopedic surgeon-designed dog wheelchairs come in 5 sizes and are fully height, length, and width adjustable for maximum comfort and ease of use. Selecting a dog wheelchair in Best Friend Mobility is easy. Wheelchair sizing is based on 5 weight classifications and further adapted to a specific dog’s measurement, needs, and comfort level through the various adjustable parts. Great Value For Money Features: Sturdy design and materials Easily and fully adjustable Lightweight aluminum frame Stainless steel hardware Accommodates pets ranging from under 5 to 175 lbs. We are confident that you will find our dog wheelchairs beyond satisfactory; so confident in fact, that we have a 100% satisfaction guarantee for each dog wheelchair we sell. If for any reason, your dog wheelchair doesn’t fit properly and you’d like to return it, we provide a 100%, no questions asked refund or exchange for a different size. Our dogs needs do not lessen with impaired mobility. On the contrary, their needs might grow and evolve. We make our dog wheelchairs to take all these into account along with factors such as the type of mobility impairment, size, weight, and breed, plus the special needs of certain dogs. We take pride in our work and in knowing that they’ll be used by creatures loved by our customers the same way we love our own. Common conditions that require the use of dog mobility aids: Hip dysplasia Neurological impairment Complete or partial rear paralysis Arthritis Spinal diseases such as Degenerative Myelopathy Lumbar or thoracic disc injury Surgical recovery Rehabilitation and therapy Any other condition that results in rear leg pain or weakness. Our dog wheelchairs are made with both style and substance.
